title: Ensuring a Data-Driven Response to COVID-19 and Future High-Consequence Public Health Threats

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to improve the collection, sharing, and public availability of COVID-19 and other high-risk public health data to better guide response efforts. It also focuses on modernizing public health data systems, promoting innovation in health data analytics, and protecting sensitive information while supporting equity and transparency.
potential_concerns: Balancing public data transparency with the need to protect privacy and national security may be challenging and cause implementation delays.
There may be difficulties in coordinating data sharing across numerous federal, state, local, Tribal, and territorial governments due to incompatible systems or bureaucratic resistance.
Efforts to rapidly hire specialized data and IT personnel could face legal or administrative hurdles within existing federal workforce rules.
The increased public release of COVID-19 related data could inadvertently contribute to misinformation if data is misinterpreted or lacks proper context.
Ensuring equity indicators and data access for marginalized communities requires ongoing oversight to prevent neglect or bias in data collection and dissemination.
